data.title: Performance issue of cocos2d-x
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.11, 3.12, 3.13, 3.14, 3.14.1
- devices test on: iPad Air, iPhone 6s
- developing environments
   - Xcode version: 8.2.1

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create new project from scratch for iOS in console with language type CPP ``./cocos new -p <package> -d <directory> -l cpp Test``
2. Launch just created project inside xCode with real iOS device;
3. Follow to Debug navigator view (see below):

## iPad Air

- Energy Impact: **Very High**, **Utilization in red area** - it is so bad for project from scratch and do nothing, but having high energy impact!
- **CPU**: 12% - for one static sprite and "Hello world" - this is unacceptable.

## iPhone 6s
- Energy Impact: **Low**, **Utilization in green area** - it is good, but
- **CPU**: 13-14%. - very bad

I'm using cocos2d-x for 6 years but I'm never faced the problems with performance like these.

Crash on Android after restore from background in Texture2D::updateWithData
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.14.1
- devices test on: Samsung Galaxy Tab A
- developing environments
   - NDK version: r10e (64-bit)

Description:
Game crashes if it was restored from background on Android, and game state was restored.
Callstack:
1. Texture2D::updateWithData()
2. FontAtlas::prepareLetterDefinitions()

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Game should use TTF font for labels. 
2. Send game to background, force system to free game's resources to force resources reloading on restore from background. (Best solution with 100% success: button with an "open Application's page on Google Play" action, and use "launch" button on that page to return to game).
3. Restore game from background
4. Game should crash on first attempt to use TTF Fonts.

Key step to reproduce crash - force game reload resources.

The Strategy of playing more than 32 audios at the same time needs to be changed
data.body:
Please refer to https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/pull/17233

- cocos2d-x version: v3.14.1
- devices test on: Android devices
- developing environments
   - NDK version: r10e
   - Xcode version: N/A
   - VS version: N/A
   - browser type and version: N/A

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Just AudioEngine::play2d(...) as many audios as possible
2. The latest audio will not be played, there is an output log:
```
Fail to play xxx.mp3 cause by limited max instance of AudioEngine.
```

### HOW TO DO:

Basically, we need to modify the behavior of playing more than `MAX` instances (32).
Currently, we just ignore the latest audio added to AudioEngine, IMO, this strategy doesn't make sense. We probably could take a look at `SoundPool` implementation in Android, which removes the oldest audio added to `AudioEngine` and re-uses it for the latest one.

data.body:
- cocos2d-x version:3.12
- devices test on:SAMSUNG Galaxy Grand2,Android4.3; Asus...and so on
- developing environments
   - NDK version:r9d
   - Xcode version:8.1

Hi,there. 
I use engine version 3.12 and now I have some problems with Label::create() on android,
if i use it like 
auto pLabel = Label::create("testlabel","res/cocostudio/ui/fonts/msyh.ttf",20);
which will cause memory leak,every time i call the function like that way,it will increase memory 3~4M (the ttf file's size is 4.3M) after i calling pLabel->removeFromParent();

but, when i use like Label::create("testlabel","",20) everything is ok

the problem just happen on android,not happend on mac

thanks a lot!

- devices test on: Mac Sierra & El Capitan
- developing environments
   - NDK version:

We're seeing a problem with a multiline EditBox (setInputMode(ui::EditBox::InputMode::ANY)).  The EditBox is at the bottom of our scene and whenever we start typing in it the typing appears at the top, outside the bounds of the EditBox.  After leaving focus of the EditBox the text snaps to the correct position.  Single line EditBox seems to work as expected.

Android Studio support
data.body:
goole guys sent a PR about Android Studio support: https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/pull/15676. I tested it and it works. Currently there is only one issue that, engine native codes and other 3rd party c++ codes can not be shown. But can use `step into` to refer to it when debugging.

Cocos console command should adjust for it too.

data.title: Random crashing of glBuffer on Ubuntu
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.14.1
- devices test on: PC Ubuntu 16.04, Mac mini 
- developing environments
   - QT Creator, CLion, CodeBlocks

Earlier for my project I use 3.11.1 version of engine. Now after update to 3.14.1 and install install-linux-deps.sh on Ubuntu I have random crashes of my application. In debug mode all crashes are in render part of engine when locate and relocate glBuffers in engine. Some times application work correct but every times crashes on close. Application crashing in function like:
```
glBindBuffer(GL_ARRAY_BUFFER, _vbo);
CC_SAFE_DELETE_ARRAY(triangles.verts);
glBufferData(GL_ELEMENT_ARRAY_BUFFER, sizeof(_indices[0]) * _filledIndex, _indices, GL_STATIC_DRAW);
```
